sermons.title: (Pdf Book) The Royal Priesthood
sermons.description: In a perishing world crying out for help, messengers are needed who come from the presence of the living God. Today Jesus Christ, our great High Priest, is asking, â€œWhom shall I send?â€

sermons.title: (The Path Of The Ark #6) The Glory of God
sermons.description: The Ark coming to its resting place experienced two surprise appearances of the glory of the Lord--Jesus Christ.  What led up to the first filling was the oceans of animal blood and praise to the Lord.  The glory of God that drove you out for justification will keep you out for sanctification.  This clincher lesson is just loaded with spiritual truth to turn your eyes to the Lord Jesus!

sermons.title: A Day In The Life Of Jehoshaphat
sermons.description: The Nation of Israel is unique among the kingdoms of the world. No matter what its condition, the nation has been present in one form or another for over 3,000 years. That is because a faithful God has guaranteed their continuance. Our continence as Christians depends on Godâ€™s faithfulness to us as well. David Roper uses one of the greatest battles in Israelâ€™s history to illustrate the point

sermons.title: A Prepared Heart
sermons.description: You must seek the Lord with all your heart, prepared to listen to him, and prepared to follow his instructions in obedience and faith. As long as Rehoboam sought the Lord, he prospered and had peace. When he stopped seeking God, and began to do things his own way, the enemy came in and stole the treasures of God out of the temple. Believers are the temple of the Holy Ghost. Take careful heed to this message.

sermons.title: Ambushing Satan with Song
sermons.description: There are three ways that God protects his people from danger. Sometimes he prevents danger from even arising on the horizon of our lives. Other times he allows the danger to attack, and gives us the victory so that we live on and serve him in gladness. But in the end one enemy is never driven off, the enemy of death. We will all die if the Lord does not return in our lifetime. But here, too, God protects. He protects us from unbelief, and preserves us for his heavenly kingdom.

sermons.title: Are You Backsliding? (Part 1)
sermons.description: This is the first hour of a two hour message given at the Brownsville Revival, which probes the hearts of those at the Revival and gives a desperate call not to be satisfied with manifestations of God’s presence, but to press on for personal, corporate and national transformation. This first hour features many stories of revival history showing that true revival completely turns masses upside down.

sermons.title: Can We Have Revival by Oswald J. Smith
sermons.description: In this sermon, Oswald Smith helps us answer the question, how can we have revival today? Smith profoundly states that revival is the result of a price paid—it costs to have a revival. He says that we must get right with God, we must travail in prayer, we must preach the word of God, not human opinion, and we must work in the anointing of the Holy Spirit. What are you willing to do to see revival in your life? In the United States? In the world?

sermons.title: Can We Have a Revival?
sermons.description: In this sermon, Oswald Smith helps us answer the question, how can we have revival today?  Smith profoundly states that revival is the result of a price paid—it costs to have a revival.  He says that we must get right with God, we must travail in prayer, we must preach the word of God, not human opinion, and we must work in the anointing of the Holy Spirit.  What are you willing to do to see revival in your life?  In the United States?  In the world?

sermons.title: Chapel of the Air - Interview with Dr. Orr (part 1)
sermons.description: In this interview, Dr. Orr speaks on the misunderstanding of the word "revival". Among other things, he discusses how revival is primarily aimed at the Church, as opposed to the lost. This is the only time I have heard Dr. Orr talk about his multiple PhD's; surely because he is asked in the interview. This interview displays the typical humility of this extremely knowledgeable and well-traveled individual who, though he is surely one of the foremost scholars on the subject of historic revival, offers correction to the modern church, but does so in a way that it is evident he is not trying to glorify himself. The late Dr. Orr expresses his desire in this interview to see revival again, and puts forth his opinion that he does not believe that future revival is reserved for the nation of Israel only.

sermons.title: Denying God's Power For Revival - Part 1
sermons.description: Brother Edgar shares a strong word on the wicked ways in Christians life's. He specifically shares about ways we deny God's power for revival in our daily walks. In this part he speaks of the lack of witnessing for Christ that we as believers in the West are not sharing our faith freely and boldly as we should. May God show us the evil in this and it to be repented of and to walk in the freedom of the Holy Spirit to be a living witness, a salt of the earth and light to this lost generation.

sermons.title: Denying God's Power For Revival And Victory
sermons.description: Brother Edgar delivers a powerful message giving a personal testimony of his victory over sin. He shows how Christians can practice besetting sins and can not walk in true victory over them. He then gives powerful testimonies of sins in the past who realized Jesus Christ as their victory over sins in practical reality in their lives.

sermons.title: Dependence Upon the Lord
sermons.description: Brother K.P. Yohannan shares powerful principles on how to work in God's spiritual kingdom. There is a great need to see God's work as God sees it. And be a part of God's work in God's way. There are many timeless thoughts and ideas in this message that will help any ministry or fellowship to continue in God's grace and purposes.

sermons.title: Do As The Lord Leads
sermons.description: When God spoke to Solomon He said, " When I shut up the heavens and there is no rain or send pestilence, if My people will humble themselves and pray, I will forgive them." In 1966 in the USSR there was a believer. He was arrested because he was a Christian. When I went there I also had to meet in a forest like the believers had to at that time. Many Christians didnâ€™t want to be in the government endorsed church. They were put on a train to northern Siberia where it is dark for six months. Many Christians died in northern Siberia from the cold. They threw him off the train so that he would die. It was very cold there and you can freeze to death. He fell into a very deep sleep. The cold caused him to want to sleep which is dangerous. Your brain can be frozen. When he woke up he said, "Whatâ€™s happening? I feel warm." It was a bear from the forest. A bear is very dangerous. He found himself embraced by the bear. He said, "Lord, you have sent a ferocious animal to help me." When he woke up, the bear also woke up. It ran off and returned with a packet. It had food and bread inside. He ate the bread that had butter and jam on it. He also gave some to the bear. What an amazing work of God!

sermons.title: Evicting Uzziah
sermons.description: September 7, 2008 - We are living in a time when men and women who say they know God are pushing themselves into places that God has not ordained for them. When human effort and human reasoning take us to the end of ourselves God will visit us by His Holy Spirit and the ordinary man will do extraordinary things. Uzziah had God's vision and could see what God saw and the Lord made him to prosper until he became wise in his own eyes and put himself in the place of God. Not soon after that he was moved out and became a leper.

sermons.title: God and His People - II Chron. 7:13-14
God is Trying to Get at That Thing in You
sermons.description: For 23 years Israel mocked the prophets God sent them with warnings of coming judgment. They refused to believe their prosperity would be ended. The root of all disobedience to God, and refusal to listen to his word is what God is trying to get at. Unbelief. A serious message we would all do well to take heed.

sermons.title: If My People
sermons.description: The focus on this sermon is revival and how it is not brought about political or social means. Quotes and references to Billy Sunday, Charles Finney, the Welsh Revival, Maze Jackson, George Muller, F B Meyer, D L Moody, and the movement of the Holy Ghost during outpourings of revival. "If you asked me the greatest need in America right now, I'd say revival. There's enough born-again believers to turn the world upside-down for Christ, if we had the right kind of Christians."

sermons.title: Necessity of Seeing Jesus as King
sermons.description: David Smithers challenges the hearers to examine their view of Jesus whether He truly be King or if we have focused upon attributes that best suit us.  "If we're interested in kingdom work," he says, "we need to be submitted to the King."  Are you subject to the King?  NOTE: (Part 1 - Necessity of Seeing Jesus as King / Part 2 - Effects of Seeing Jesus as King / Part 3 - Repentance (High Quality))

sermons.title: Our Canadian Christian Heritage Under Fire #5 - We Need Revival in Canada
sermons.description:
Revival in Saskatoon! The visit of Duncan Campbell to the Prairies and his message that revival would come to Canada. This text is promise to God's people that we must plead for revival in this land.
Here is hope for Gospel lovers in Canada.

sermons.title: Place Of Bible In Future Revival
Revival
sermons.description:
Revival, says David Legge, 'is a message that burns on my heart continually...Revival is God's norm.'  Because revival has been 'one of the greatest stimulants' in his Christian life, the message is marked by stirring accounts of the past--Lewis, Wales, China and others.  Legge cries out against the sins of evangelicalism and unbelief, causing to search if we truly be filled with the Holy Spirit.

sermons.title: Revival Series 6
sermons.description: "Now when Solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down from heaven...and the glory of the LORD filled the house." Revival fire falls on an altar prepared by intercessory prayer. But beware of wildfire, which substitutes human ingenuity for the Holy Spirit's energies.

sermons.title: Revive Us Again
sermons.description: This is not so much a teaching as it is the groanings of a burdened heart to exalt God above man to His rightful place in revival.  Campbell shared several practical "principles that govern spiritual quickening."  The differences between a God-sent revival and the man-centered evangelistic means of his day are truly heart-searching for anyone engaged in work to save men's souls.  Since God's sovereignty does not nullify man's responsibility, Campbell admonished his hearers to be "agents of revival" that take God up on "His covenant engagement" in prayer and staying close to the heart of the Shepherd.

sermons.title: Seeking God
sermons.description: Pastor Cymbala looks at King Asa's life and the consequences of not seeking God. You will be encouraged with the the scripture from the book of Hebrews showing that God rewards those who seek Him. 2 Chron. 14:1-7, 16:10-12, Heb 11:6 (NIV)

sermons.title: The Burden and Blessing of Revival
sermons.description: If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.

sermons.title: The Fire of God
sermons.description: Duncan Campbell looks around at all the darkness and apostacy around and answers the question: "Why is revival not coming?"  He cites some examples from the past to point out that the God of Elijah is alive and hears the sincere cry of the heart.  What opens God's ears, Campbell teaches, is a life offered wholly on the altar to where we can say, "God, you've got the last piece."

sermons.title: The Glory Of God And The Image Of Jealousy
sermons.description: This is a message about how God will not compete with idolatry for the hearts and minds of his people. Instead he will lift his glory from their lives. He reluctantly took his glory from Israel as illustrated in Ezekiel, and nobody even noticed, for the priests were busy with their secret things. Whatever you give your time and attention to the most is what is influencing your character and is becoming your idol. Too many go to church, going through the motions on Sunday and the rest of the week devote themselves to their own pursuits and pleasures and wonder why they can't feel God's presence. God desires to dwell among his people. But when they don't like to retain the knowledge of God, when they prefer an appearance of godliness with no power it will lead to destruction.

sermons.title: The God Who Judges Kings And Nations Today
sermons.description: Brother Dan Biser gives a solemn word on a prayer conference call about the current state of America and the Church. He clearly shows every sin and action is before a holy God who has to judge wickedness in our society. May this message build a solemn fear of the Lord in our day that we may confess our sins and seek the mercy of God through Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: The Obedience That Prepares The Way
The Point Of No Return
sermons.description: Paul faced incredible troubles including the real possibility of death. Pastor Cymbala teaches that faith is at it's purest point when you have nothing else to lean on but Jesus.

sermons.title: The Role Of Prayer In Spiritual Awakening
sermons.description: This is one of Dr. Orr's most well-known messages on Revival and Prayer. This is a must hear message and is very short and to the point. It was spoken before a Campus Crusade for Christ fellowship or gathering. The many years of J. Edwin Orr's ministry and burden for revival really show through in this small sermon on the role of revival and prayer in God's awakening of the redeemed and saving of the lost.

sermons.title: The Role Of Prayer In Spiritual Awakening by J. Edwin Orr
sermons.description: This is one of Dr. Orr's most well-known messages on Revival and Prayer. This is a must watch video and is very short and to the point. It was spoken before a Campus Crusade for Christ fellowship or gathering. The many years of J. Edwin Orr's ministry and burden for revival really show through in this small sermon on the role of revival and prayer in God's awakening of the redeemed and saving of the lost.

sermons.title: The Shocking Sin of A Perfect Heart
sermons.description: It is possible for a person to live a life of holiness, full of the blessings of God and yet come to some point in your life when you commit a shocking sin even though before this time you possessed a perfect heart.  Using King Asa as an example, Wilkerson takes teaches us a lesson of caution.

sermons.title: The Watchtower in the Wilderness
sermons.description: The account of Jehosophat in 2 Chronicles 20 is skillfully used to encourage the listener who is in a battle with the enemy and in fear. A hopeful message on the power of God to remove those doubts and fears and to see a defeated enemy.

sermons.title: To Late To Cancel Judgment by John Franklin
sermons.description: The message by John Franklin  was about expectations if we repent .  He starts out with II Chronicles 6:36 . He says that we need to know how judgment functions and works and how to respond correctly.  He then goes to II Samuel 12:7  where Nathan confronts David.  David confesses - repents but it did not cancel the judgment.  John Franklin's expectations of the coming days is if we come to the place of revival, he believes we can be forgiven and restored to God, but it is too late to cancel our judgment.

sermons.title: What Keeps Revival Back?
sermons.description: This verse contains a challenge and a wonderful promise. God speaks directly to his people, not the gentiles but to the believers. "If my people return to me and humble themselves, they will receive forgiveness of sin." God sees the sin and if people repent of their sin, God will heal their land. This text is an inspiration to every believer. The challenge is that the world is in our hands. If we repent and get right with God, our land will be healed and restored. We are not to point to the sin of other people but to ourselves and if we repent the Lord will heal our land. God requires that we humble ourselves. This word was said to Solomon where God said, "If my people will humble themselves and turn from their wicked ways, I will heal the land." Things can be turned around if people have an ear to hear what God says.

sermons.title: When a Man of God Loses His Faith
sermons.description: Preaching from 2 Chronicles, Wilkerson preaches using King Asa as an example.  Paul recorded in his writings that the Old Testament is there as an example to us so we need to heed what is being said.  This message should cause us all pause long enough to examine ourselves.

sermons.title: Your Friends Matter to God
sermons.description: This message is going to convict most of us.  Wilkerson preaches on the importance of choosing our friends.  He isnâ€™t speaking of those you work with or have a business or casual contact with.  He is speaking of the person that you allow in the inner circle of your life.  This person is likely a type and shadow of your own Christian walk.
